images.figText: The electromagnetic spectrum shows all forms of electromagnetic radiation arranged in order of wavelengths.
Visible light colors arranged in order of wavelengths from the shortest (violet) to the longest (red).

contents.content: There are many types of light (also known as electromagnetic radiation): radio waves, infrared, visible, ultraviolet (UV), X-rays, etc. The type of light we can see with our eyes is called “visible” light.

You may have learned the acronym “Roy G. Biv” to remember the order of the colors of the visible part of the electromagnetic spectrum. These different colors correspond to different wavelengths and energies, with red having the lowest energy and the longest wavelengths and violet having the highest energy and the shortest wavelengths.
